Academic Requirements: · At least a Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry, Biochemistry, or equivalent · With Professional License in Chemistry, certified Microbiologist, Licensed Medical technologist, whichever is applicable Work Experience / Skills: Fresh graduate or with 1-year work experience in the laboratory With the basic knowledge on analytical methods done in the assigned department and on equipment With background knowledge on ISO/IEC 17025 Duties and Responsibilities: · Performs detailed preparation and analysis of samples according to published methods and laboratory procedures; · Processes and evaluates raw data obtained from preparation and analysis steps; · Generates final results from raw data, performing primary review against method criteria; · Monitors quality control data associated with analysis and preparation. JOB QUALIFICATIONS Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree, Professional License (Passed Board/Bar/Professional License Exam) in Engineering (Chemical), Chemistry or equivalent. JOB DESCRIPTION Performs job functions consistent with the corporate vision and mission statement and core values of the company. Performs routine physical and chemical analyses of raw materials, finished goods, and returned goods stocks; responds to related / special requests for the conduct of laboratory analysis from internal customers. Prepares standard solutions for chemical analysis. Undertakes regular validation of reliability of precision instruments and methodologies and processes for laboratory analyses. Informs Quality Assurance Inspector on results of analysis to serve as guide for quality control disposition. Reports non-conforming products as determined from laboratory analysis to the Quality Assurance Supervisor for proper disposition. Documents results of analyses and submits to the Quality Assurance Supervisor. Conducts research on analytical procedures for application / adaptation in order to enhance laboratory capabilities. Updates raw material specifications and analytical procedures annually or as needed. Maintains cleanliness, orderliness and safety of the laboratory as well as the equipment / apparatus therein. Assists in the preventive maintenance and trouble-shooting repair of laboratory equipment; arranges for repair of equipment by third party service providers in instances when internal capabilities are inadequate for the purpose. Conducts regular inventory of reagents and glassware; prepares requisitions for needed replacements. Submits monthly reports on work performance outputs with corresponding analysis and recommendations to the Quality Control Supervisor / Head. Performs such other duties and responsibilities related to and/or implied from the above enumeration.
